articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop meets Namibian prime minister
articles.content:
Greetings to Moldovan prime minister 
    Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) - Premier Hong Song Nam sent a message of greetings to Moldovan prime minister Vasile Tarlev on the occasion of its National Day.
 In the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms, the message wished him greater success in his work for the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Russia visit hailed
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop meets Namibian prime minister
    Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) --Yyang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on a visit to Namibia met and had a friendly talk with Namibian prime minister Hage Geingob on Sunday.
 The prime minister said that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries provided by President Kim Il Sung and President Sam Nujoma are developing on good terms.    
 He extended sincere thanks to General Secretary Kim Jong Il for assisting the Namibian people.
 He hoped that the Korean people would achieve the reunification of the country and Korea would prosper under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Probe into truth behind explosion of Ukishima Maru
"Peace policy" of Ri Hoe Chang condemned
articles.content:
Probe into truth behind explosion of Ukishima Maru
    Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- Bereaved families of victims and survivors of the explosion of Ukishima Maru by the Japanese army 57 years ago held a joint memorial service for the dead in Seoul on August 24, according to Seoul-based Radio No. 1.
 They said that the explosion was premeditated by the defeated Japanese army and over 5,000 of at least 7,500 people aboard the ship were drowned, but the Japanese government claimed that the death toll was more than 500 people to curtail it and cover up the truth. They demanded a thorough probe and damages.    
 The explosion incident was known to the world when a complaint document addressed to the then commander of the U.S. Forces in Japan four months later was found at the diet library of Japan in 1990. However, the Japanese government has so far asserted that the ship was hit and sunk by a mine laid by the U.S. army, which has evoked resentment.

North side's delegation leaves for Seoul
     Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- The north side's delegation led by first vice-chairman of the State Planning Commission Pak Chang Ryon, north side's chairman of the north-south committee for the promotion of economic cooperation, left here today to participate in the second meeting of the committee to be held in Seoul.
 It was seen off at the airport by Ro Tu Chol, vice-chairman of the State Planning Commission, Jong Un Op, chairman of the national economic cooperation federation, and officials concerned.

Greetings to Angolan President
articles.content:
Greetings to Moldovan President 
    Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, today sent a message of greetings to Moldovan President Vladimir Voronin on the occasion of the 11th National Day.
 The message wished him greater success in his responsible work for peace and prosperity of the country and expressed belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and the Moldovan Republic would grow stronger in the interests of the two peoples.
